com.nextpeer.android
Class NextpeerListener

java.lang.Object
  com.nextpeer.android.NextpeerListener

public abstract class NextpeerListener
extends java.lang.Object

Callback class that you provide to Nextpeer.initialize() to get notified of Nextpeer-related events. You can use this to enable or disable Nextpeer-related UI in your Activities if the user logs out, or suspend game updates if the Dashboard opens, for example.

Constructor Summary
NextpeerListener()
           
 
Method Summary
 void onNextpeerAppear()
          This method is called when Nextpeer's view opens.
 void onNextpeerDisappear()
          This method is called when Nextpeer's view disappear (For example when the user pressed on the back button or when the dashboard hides its screen before the game supports to start).
 void onNextpeerReturnToGame()
          This method will be called when the player closes Nextpeer's view and returns to the game (For example when the user pressed on the back button).
 void onReceiveTournamentCustomMessage(NextpeerTournamentCustomMessage message)
          This method will be called when Nextpeer has received a buffer from another player.
 void onReceiveTournamentStatus(NextpeerTournamentStatusInfo tournamentStatus)
          This method is invoked when a tournament status is reported.
 void onReceiveUnreliableTournamentCustomMessage(NextpeerTournamentCustomMessage message)
          This method will be called when Nextpeer has received a buffer from another player.
 boolean onSupportsTournament(java.lang.String tournamentUuid)
          Guide the SDK whether the game supports the given tournament.

onNextpeerDisappear

public void onNextpeerDisappear()
This method is called when Nextpeer's view disappear (For example when the user pressed on the back button or when the dashboard hides its screen before the game supports to start).

onNextpeerReturnToGame

public void onNextpeerReturnToGame()
This method will be called when the player closes Nextpeer's view and returns to the game (For example when the user pressed on the back button).

onTournamentStart

public abstract void onTournamentStart(NextpeerTournamentStartData startData)
Called when the tournament is supposed to start. Here is the place to the launch the game's activity.

Parameters:
startData - Can give you some details on the tournament which is about to be played. For example the tournament UUID, name and time.

onTournamentEnd

public abstract void onTournamentEnd(NextpeerTournamentEndData endData)
Called when the tournament is supposed to end.

Parameters:
endData - The data about the tournament end NextpeerTournamentEndData

onSupportsTournament

public boolean onSupportsTournament(java.lang.String tournamentUuid)
Guide the SDK whether the game supports the given tournament. This method s called once for each tournament UUID that is present in the dashboard. If this particular game version doesn't support a certain tournament, use this method to tell the SDK to disable it.

Parameters:
tournamentUuid - The tournament identifier as it available on Nextpeer's developers dashboard (https://developers.nextpeer.com) for the game.
Returns:
true if you support this tournament, false otherwise (default true).

onReceiveTournamentCustomMessage

public void onReceiveTournamentCustomMessage(NextpeerTournamentCustomMessage message)
This method will be called when Nextpeer has received a buffer from another player. You can use these buffers to create custom notifications and events while engaging the other players that are currently playing. The container that is passed contains the sending user's name and image as well as the message being sent.

Parameters:
message - The custom message NextpeerTournamentCustomMessage

onReceiveUnreliableTournamentCustomMessage

public void onReceiveUnreliableTournamentCustomMessage(NextpeerTournamentCustomMessage message)
This method will be called when Nextpeer has received a buffer from another player. The message would have come from the unreliable data channel. This channel is mostly used to provide game state updates between players. The container that is passed contains the sending user's name and image as well as the message being sent.

Parameters:
message - The custom message NextpeerTournamentCustomMessage

onReceiveTournamentStatus

public void onReceiveTournamentStatus(NextpeerTournamentStatusInfo tournamentStatus)
This method is invoked when a tournament status is reported. A tournament status includes information regarding all the players in the tournament - their ranks, who is still playing, their names, IDs, avatar images, etc. This information can be used to, for example, generate custom ranking notifications. The rate of tournament status updates is approximately one per second.

Parameters:
tournamentStatus - The NextpeerTournamentStatusInfo representing the last update from the tournament.
